REQUIREMENT.Text: The ICAS1Gen2::Stellar::BAP Wrapper shall call BAP_Task every 10ms.
For each LSG configured in BAP config the ICAS1Gen2::Stellar::BAP Wrapper shall initialize BAP Stack via Bap_Init(LSGID).
For each LSG configured in BAP config the ICAS1Gen2::Stellar::BAP Wrapper shall cyclically evaluate BAP_Freigabe signal.

For each LSG configured in BAP config the ICAS1Gen2::Stellar::BAP Wrapper shall cyclically evaluate state of buses relevant for each LSG.
Additional information: Please refer to Interface Section to see which buses are relevant for each LSG.
IF LSG BAP_Enable == 0x01 AND at least one LSG relevant bus is active THEN the ICAS1Gen2::Stellar::BAP Wrapper shall start BAP communication via BAP_Start for that LSG
IF LSG BAP_Enable == 0x00 OR all LSG relevant buses are not active THEN the ICAS1Gen2::Stellar::BAP Wrapper shall stop BAP communication via BAP_Shutdown for that LSG

The ICAS1Gen2::Stellar::BAP Wrapper shall prevent multiple calls to BAP stack at the same time. Therefore if there is a second call to BAP Stack the ICAS1Gen2::Stellar::BAP Wrapper shall block this call until the first one is finished.
Additional information: Implementation of the BAP Stack is not reentrant and Stellar is a multi-core system, therefore it could happen that few LSG applications would call BAP Wrapper at the same time, which needs to be prevented.

IF the ICAS1Gen2::Stellar::BAP Wrapper received BAP_Debug_Cmd message with Debug-Ctrl == 0x01 AND BAP-Debug Botschaften coding == 0x01 AND BAP Stack debug mode is not currently active THEN the ICAS1Gen2::Stellar::BAP Wrapper shall switch the BAP Stack into a debug mode by providing Mux and Debug-Ctrl parameters (received in BAP_Debug_Cmd) in BAP_ProcessDebugControl function
Additional information: Structure of header of the BAP_Debug_Cmd message:
Mux - LSG-ID to be switched Debug-Ctrl - 0x00: switch off; 0x01: switch on; 0x02..0xFF: reserved for future extensions
IF BAP Stack calls a BAP_SendDebugInfo function on the ICAS1Gen2::Stellar::BAP Wrapper THEN the ICAS1Gen2::Stellar::BAP Wrapper shall send BAP_Debug_Data message with data provided from BAP Stack

IF at least one BAP Stack debug relevant bus goes to sleep for the second time OR BAP-Debug Botschaften coding == 0x00 OR the ICAS1Gen2::Stellar::BAP Wrapper received BAP_Debug_Cmd message with Debug-Ctrl == 0x00 THEN the ICAS1Gen2::Stellar::BAP Wrapper shall switch off BAP Stack debug mode by providing Debug-Ctrl = 0x00 in BAP_ProcessDebugControl function
Additional information: The debug mode remains switched on during the first bus-sleep and it needs to be switched off by ICAS1Gen2::Stellar::BAP Wrapper after the second bus-sleep.

For each CanTxMessage configured in BAP config, the ICAS1Gen2::Stellar::BAP Bus Interface shall provide TXHandlePduId for communication with BAP Stack.
The ICAS1Gen2::Stellar::BAP Bus Interface shall assign exactly the same Handle name as specified in BAP config "id" attribute.
Additional information: TXHandlePduId doesn't necessarily equal to actual bus message ID.

For each CanRxMessage configured in BAP config, the ICAS1Gen2::Stellar::BAP Bus Interface shall provide RXHandlePduId for communication with BAP Stack.
The ICAS1Gen2::Stellar::BAP Bus Interface shall assign exactly the same Handle name as specified in BAP config "id" attribute.
Additional information: RXHandlePduId doesn't necessarily equal to actual bus message ID.

The ICAS1Gen2::Stellar::BAP Bus Interface shall implement void BAP_CANUBS_InitReadyForTx (BapCanInterfaceChannel_t aCanInterfaceChannel, BapCanMsgId_t aCanMsgId) function as "Init" function.
Via the BAP_CANUBS_InitReadyForTx function, the ICAS1Gen2::Stellar::BAP Bus Interface shall initialize the BAP messages TxBuffer for every CAN and VLAN message listed in Network Outputs in Interface Section.

The ICAS1Gen2::Stellar::BAP Bus Interface shall implement bool_t BAP_CANUBS_IsReadyForTx(BapCanInterfaceChannel_t aCanInterfaceChannel, BapCanMsgId_t aCanMsgId) function.
IF no BAP message was sent yet OR the ICAS1Gen2::Stellar::BAP Bus Interface received confirmation that previous BAP message was sent THEN the ICAS1Gen2::Stellar::BAP Bus Interface shall return TRUE ELSE the ICAS1Gen2::Stellar::BAP Bus Interface shall return FALSE

The ICAS1Gen2::Stellar::BAP Bus Interface shall monitor amount of FALSE returns on BAP_CANUBS_IsReadyForTx function.
IF the amount of FALSE returns exceeded amount defined in BAP_MAX_CONFIRMATION_FLAG_TIMEOUT THEN the ICAS1Gen2::Stellar::BAP Bus Interface shall return TRUE
After the ICAS1Gen2::Stellar::BAP Bus Interface returned TRUE, monitoring of FALSE returns is done from the beginning.
Additional information: BAP_MAX_CONFIRMATION_FLAG_TIMEOUT is defined in BAP Stack.

The ICAS1Gen2::Stellar::BAP Bus Interface shall implement bool_t BAP_CANUBS_TxData(BapCanInterfaceChannel_t aCanInterfaceChannel, BapCanMsgId_t aCanMsgId, const ptr_t apData, uint8_t au8Length) function.
IF the BAP Stack called the BAP_CANUBS_TxData function THEN the ICAS1Gen2::Stellar::BAP Bus Interface shall send received data
Additional information: aCanMsgId maps to TXHandlePduId. Messages can be sent on multiple buses, please refer to Network Outputs in Interface Section.

IF the ICAS1Gen2::Stellar::BAP Bus Interface received a BAP message THEN the ICAS1Gen2::Stellar::BAP Bus Interface shall forward received data to BAP Stack via the BAP_CANUBS_RxData(DBGVAR BapCanInterfaceChannel_t aCanInterfaceChannel, DBGVAR BapCanMsgId_t aCanMsgId, DBGVAR const ptr_t apData, DBGVAR uint8_t au8Length) function
Additional information: aCanMsgId maps to RXHandlePduId.
